modName: DreezNation Lighting Tweaks (Performance Friendly Exterior Lighting)
summary: Boosts saturation, and decreases night brightness using vanilla assets.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5]Requirements: Skyrim, nothing else needed[/size]





[size=4]By request added a second file which makes nights a little less dark (vanilla multiplier for brightness changed from 1/3 to 2/5)[/size]

This is a mod I made for myself personally. I have a low quality computer (I gotta disable shadows and all kinds of settings just to be able to move without lag). I have always been disappointed with vanilla visual settings. Everything looks too whitewashed and I dont even realize when the sun is up or down. I tried to find other mods that accomplished this, but most deal with ENB and all that fancy stuff. So I took matters into my own hands!

[size=5]Here is DreezNation Lighting Tweaks. Nights are dark and you need a torch, Days are vanilla brightness, Dusk and Dawn changes are now noticeable and cool to watch with the game time multiplier way up. Saturation is boosted to the boarder-line. All setting changes were calculated by a multiplier to the vanilla settings. (This means the vanilla saturation and brightness change between a rainy day or clear day are still present). Pictures were included to help viewer see the difference between night and day.[/size]

I really enjoy this change. The way I use this mod with my computer's visual settings is: My computer and monitor settings are factory. However, monitor backlight is set to 0 (that way I can play for a while without murdering my eyes).

If you try this mod out and it does not fit to your desires I can make some adjustments, you can request in the comments or via message. One thing to note though, is I will never have your computer's settings so I won't be good at making something look better for you. Best thing you can do is take this mod into Tes5 edit and change the settings to your liking.

Before I leave you to your downloading/gaming I must first give credit where due. First to Bethedesa, and then to Aplestormy who created [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32064/?]Immersive Saturation Boost[/url]. I did not use any assets from the mod, but my ideas were a direct result of viewing the mod.
author: DreezNation
